symptoms.name: Ulcers
symptoms.pattern: Well-demarcated, often covered with pseudo-membranes, slow-healing, located on limbs

Culture.abnormal_range: Presence of Corynebacterium diphtheriae or Corynebacterium ulcerans, often with co-infection of Staphylococcus aureus and Streptococcus pyogenes

Throat swab.abnormal_range: Positive for C. diphtheriae or C. ulcerans carriage

MALDI-TOF.abnormal_range: Rapid screening for identification of bacterial pathogens, including C. diphtheriae

PCR.abnormal_range: Confirms the presence of C. diphtheriae and detects toxigenicity

risk_factors: Travel to countries with endemic disease

required: Isolation of Corynebacterium diphtheriae or Corynebacterium ulcerans from cutaneous swabs
supportive: Clinical presentation of well-demarcated ulcers, possibly with pseudo-membranes
History of travel to endemic areas
